<a id="SubViewport"></a>

# SubViewport

**Inherits:** [Viewport](Viewport.md) **\<** [Node](Node.md) **\<** [Object](Object.md)

An interface to a game world that doesn't create a window or draw to the screen directly.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

**SubViewport** Isolates a rectangular region of a scene to be displayed independently. This can be used, for example, to display UI in 3D space.

\ **Note:** **SubViewport** is a [Viewport](Viewport.md) that isn't a [Window](Window.md), i.e. it doesn't draw anything by itself. To display anything, **SubViewport** must have a non-zero size and be either put inside a [SubViewportContainer](SubViewportContainer.md) or assigned to a [ViewportTexture](ViewportTexture.md).

\ **Note:** [InputEvent](InputEvent.md)\\ s are not passed to a standalone **SubViewport** by default. To ensure [InputEvent](InputEvent.md) propagation, a **SubViewport** can be placed inside of a [SubViewportContainer](SubViewportContainer.md).

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

<a id="SubViewport_constant_CLEAR_MODE_ALWAYS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode) **CLEAR_MODE_ALWAYS** = `0`

Always clear the render target before drawing.<a id="SubViewport_constant_CLEAR_MODE_NEVER"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode) **CLEAR_MODE_NEVER** = `1`

Never clear the render target.<a id="SubViewport_constant_CLEAR_MODE_ONCE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode) **CLEAR_MODE_ONCE** = `2`

Clear the render target on the next frame, then switch to [CLEAR_MODE_NEVER](SubViewport.md#SubViewport_constant_CLEAR_MODE_NEVER).<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration -->

enum **UpdateMode**: [ðŸ”—](#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode)

<a id="SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_DISABLED"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **UPDATE_DISABLED** = `0`

Do not update the render target.<a id="SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_ONCE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **UPDATE_ONCE** = `1`

Update the render target once, then switch to [UPDATE_DISABLED](SubViewport.md#SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_DISABLED).<a id="SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_WHEN_VISIBLE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **UPDATE_WHEN_VISIBLE** = `2`

Update the render target only when it is visible. This is the default value.<a id="SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_WHEN_PARENT_VISIBLE"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **UPDATE_WHEN_PARENT_VISIBLE** = `3`

Update the render target only when its parent is visible.<a id="SubViewport_constant_UPDATE_ALWAYS"></a>

<!-- classref-enumeration-constant -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **UPDATE_ALWAYS** = `4`

Always update the render target.<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

## Property Descriptions

<a id="SubViewport_property_render_target_clear_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode) **render_target_clear_mode** = `0` [ðŸ”—](#SubViewport_property_render_target_clear_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_clear_mode**\ (\ value\: [ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode)\ )
- [ClearMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_ClearMode) **get_clear_mode**\ (\ )

The clear mode when the sub-viewport is used as a render target.

\ **Note:** This property is intended for 2D usage.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SubViewport_property_render_target_update_mode"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **render_target_update_mode** = `2` [ðŸ”—](#SubViewport_property_render_target_update_mode)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_update_mode**\ (\ value\: [UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode)\ )
- [UpdateMode](SubViewport.md#enum_SubViewport_UpdateMode) **get_update_mode**\ (\ )

The update mode when the sub-viewport is used as a render target.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SubViewport_property_size"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **size** = `Vector2i(512, 512)` [ðŸ”—](#SubViewport_property_size)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_size**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_size**\ (\ )

The width and height of the sub-viewport. Must be set to a value greater than or equal to 2 pixels on both dimensions. Otherwise, nothing will be displayed.

\ **Note:** If the parent node is a [SubViewportContainer](SubViewportContainer.md) and its [SubViewportContainer.stretch](SubViewportContainer.md#SubViewportContainer_property_stretch) is ``true``, the viewport size cannot be changed manually.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SubViewport_property_size_2d_override"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **size_2d_override** = `Vector2i(0, 0)` [ðŸ”—](#SubViewport_property_size_2d_override)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_size_2d_override**\ (\ value\: [Vector2i](Vector2i.md)\ )
- [Vector2i](Vector2i.md) **get_size_2d_override**\ (\ )

The 2D size override of the sub-viewport. If either the width or height is ``0``, the override is disabled.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="SubViewport_property_size_2d_override_stretch"></a>

<!-- classref-property -->

[bool](bool.md) **size_2d_override_stretch** = `false` [ðŸ”—](#SubViewport_property_size_2d_override_stretch)

<!-- classref-property-setget -->

- `void` **set_size_2d_override_stretch**\ (\ value\: [bool](bool.md)\ )
- [bool](bool.md) **is_size_2d_override_stretch_enabled**\ (\ )

If ``true``, the 2D size override affects stretch as well.
